Course-name: Service Management: Integrating Strategy, Operations, and Technology
content:
Services are central to the economic activity in any society; and service sector plays an important role in the economies of nations and in world commerce. No economy can function without services such as transportation, communication, utility, emergency, and government services, and so on. Service sector accounts for majority share of GDP (more than 80%) of developed nations, and has also the largest share of total employment. Services touch the lives of every individual every day. Service Operations Management has developed as a professional discipline having its own body of knowledge and skills.

The objective of this course is to familiarize the students to the strategic and operational aspects of managing services; and help them to acquaint with the service management tools and techniques, and enhance their skills in managing and improving services. It would also provide them a holistic view of service management covering new service design and delivery, improve service quality, manage service capacity and demand, service inventory, and service projects to mention a few.
